article: One night recently, I was driving down a two-lane highway at about 60 miles an hour. A car approached from the  _  direction at about the same speed. As we  _  each other, I caught the other driver's eye for only a second. I wondered whether he might be  _  as I was, how dependent we were on each other at that moment. I was relying on him not to fall  _  not to be put off by a phone conversation, not to cross over into my lane and bring my life to a sudden  _  . Though we had  _  spoken a word to each other, he relied on me in just the same way. Multiplied a million times over, I believe that is the way the world  _  At some  _  , we all depend upon one another. Sometimes that dependence requires us  _  not to do something like crossing over the double yellow line. And sometimes it requires us to act  _  , with friends or even with  _  . As technology  _  our world, the need increases for cooperative action among nations. In 2003, doctors in five nations were quickly organized to identify the SARS virus, which  _  thousands of lives. The threat of international terrorism has shown itself to be a  _  problem, one requiring coordinated action by police and intelligence forces across the world' We must recognize that our fates are not ours  _  to control. In my own life, I've put great stock in  _  responsibility.  _  , as the years have passed, I've also come to believe that there are moments when one must rely upon the good faith and judgment of  _  So, while each of us faces the case of driving alone down a  _  road, what we must learn is that the approaching light may not be a threat, but a shared moment of  _  .
